CollectionTemplate.description: A grouping of educational units. In the context of Edu-API an education is any kind of canonical or non-instantiated learning units that have a structured relationship, e.g. a course. When grouped, these educational units can be used to define such concepts as programs of study.

minNumberStudents.description: The minimum number of students allowed to enroll for this offering

synchronicity.description: An indicator of whether instructor and learner must both be present at the same time

parent.description: A reference to the parent courseOffering.

items.description: A reference to a `CourseOffering` object that has an allocated sourcedId (`GUID`).

registrationStatus.description: The status of the entity indicating whether it is open for enrollment for teachers and students. This is represented by an extensible enumerated vocabulary.

roleEnablement.description: An array to store associated dates for a course offering. Specifically, additional important date and time offsets surrounding when specific roles may be associated with the course offering before or after the official start and end dates. These dates are meant to be considered additional metadata about the course offering and applied independent of the startDate and endDate. They are not intended to be used to as replacements.

offeringType.description: A representation of what the entity defines. It is based on an extensible enumerated vocabulary.

endDate.description: The end date of the associated event.

description.description: A set of descriptions of the associated entity with a designated language for each entry.

title.description: A set of titles for the associated entity with a designated language for each entry.

paceOfStudy.description: The tempo that the course is taught at as a percentage of a normal course.

enrolledNumberStudents.description: The number of students that have already enrolled for this offering

academicSessionCode.description: A business code that a system might use to reference an academic session.

offeringFormat.description: The modality by which the entity is delivered. This is represented by an extensible enumerated vocabulary

dateLastModified.description: A timestamp describing when this record was last modified.

teachingLanguage.description: The main language used to relay the content of the offering.

sourcedId.description: The sourcedId of the object. This is the interoperability identifier that systems will refer to when making API calls, or when needing to identify an object. Systems SHOULD be able to map whichever local ids (e.g. database key fields) they use to sourcedId. The sourcedId of an object MUST be an anonymized or pseudonymized identifier of an entity and as such will not contain Personally Identifiable Information (PII) or Personal Data (PD).

otherCodes.description: Human readable codes/identifiers for the entity being described

pendingNumberStudents.description: The number of students that have a pending enrollment request for this offering

recordLanguage.description: The primary language used in the described entity.

academicSession.description: A reference to an Edu-API Academic Session

maxNumberStudents.description: The maximum number of students allowed to enroll for this offering

recordStatus.description: The status of this record. A record which is flagged 'toBeDeleted' is to be considered safe to delete. Systems can delete records that are flagged as such if they wish, but they are not required to do so.

organizationCode.description: A business code used to system might use to reference an organization

organization.description: A reference to an Edu-API Organization.

locations.description: A container for describing where the entity takes place. This could be as a description or as a geo location

startDate.description: The start date of the associated event.

ComponentOffering.description: A subsection of a courseOffering. It may be a lesson or separately enrollable unit within a courseOffering. For example, Biology 101 may consist of a Lecture component offering and a Lab component offering

agentType.description: A description of the relationship between the agent and the person the are an agent for. This is based on an extensible enumerated vocabulary.

person.description: A reference to an Edu-API person. This represents the person acting in an agency capacity.

domain.description: The context within which the person can act as an agent in.

description.description: A set of descriptions of the associated entity with a designated language for each entry.

Agents.description: A container with the set of Edu-API persons that can act on behalf of the person in question. This includes description of the type of relationship exists and the context it is applicable in.

role.description: The role of the associated person in the given context.

endDate.description: The end date of the associated event.

startDate.description: The start date of the associated event.

RoleEnablement.description: An array to store associated dates for a entity. Specifically, additional important date and time offsets surrounding when specific roles may be associated with the course offering before or after the official start and end dates. These dates are meant to be considered additional metadata about the course offering and applied independent of the startDate and endDate. They are not intended to be used to as replacements.

organizationExtensions.description: Extension properties related to education organizations

GeoCoordinates.description: The geographic coordinates of a location.

educationExtensions.description: Extension properties related to education templates

phoneType.description: The type of address. This is based on an extensible enumerated vocabulary.

sourcedId.description: The sourcedId of the object. This is the interoperability identifier that systems will refer to when making API calls, or when needing to identify an object. Systems SHOULD be able to map whichever local ids (e.g. database key fields) they use to sourcedId. The sourcedId of an object MUST be an anonymized or pseudonymized identifier of an entity and as such will not contain Personally Identifiable Information (PII) or Personal Data (PD).

otherEmails.description: Additional email addresses of a subject.

placeOfBirth.description: The place of birth. Commonly a city or municipality.

gender.description: The gender of the individual. It is based on an extensible enumerated vocabulary.

dateOfDeath.description: The date of death. The presence of this property means that the person being described is known to be deceased. In scenarios where this conflicts with the `isDeceased` flag, this property takes precedence and consuming systems should interpret that as the person being deceased.

recordLanguage.description: The primary language used in the described entity.

formattedName.description: the long form formatted name, this will often be dependent on region or system requirements.

agents.description: A container used that define relationships between an Edu-API person and other Edu-API Persons who can represent or act on behalf of them. This includes a way to describe the type of relationship between the two people. E.g. Parents or Guardians often serve as the agent for a student.

isDeceased.description: Used to identify if the person being described is alive or dead. If this property is absent or set to `false` but the `dateOfDeath` property is set, then the consuming system should interpret that as the person being deceased.

otherIdentifiers.description: A list of additional identifiers for the described entity.

otherNames.description: A list of other names for this person.

dateLastModified.description: A timestamp describing when this record was last modified.

recordStatus.description: The status of this record. A record which is flagged 'toBeDeleted' is to be considered safe to delete. Systems can delete records that are flagged as such if they wish, but they are not required to do so.

otherPhones.description: A list of other phone numbers

pronouns.description: Pronoun(s) by which this person is referenced. Examples (in the case of English) include 'she/her/hers', 'he/him/his', 'they/them/theirs', 'ze/hir/hir', 'xe/xir', or a statement that the person's name should be used instead of any pronoun.

languagesSpoken.description: The list of languages that this person speaks.

Person.description: A Person represents a human being, alive or deceased, real or imaginary.

description.description: A set of descriptions of the associated entity with a designated language for each entry.

Location.description: A container for describing the location an entity takes place at.

filter.name: filter
filter.description: Specifies that the returned collection should be filtered using the supplied criteria.

schema.description: Character strings.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Specifices the number of the first record to be supplied in the segmented response message. Default: 0.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Specifices the download segmentation value i.e. the maximum number of records to be contained in the response. Default: 100.

orderBy.name: orderBy
orderBy.description: Specifies whether the collection should be ordered ascending (asc) or descending (desc).

schema.description: Character strings.

sort.name: sort
sort.description: Specifies that the collection should be sorted on the given data field value. The form of ordering is implementation dependent if the 'orderBy' attribute is not used.

schema.description: Character strings.

X-Total-Count.description: The total number of resources that are available to be returned

scopes.http://purl.1edtech.org/spec/eduapi/v1p0: Default read-only scope. Enables access to all GET operations except those in PersonManagement
Enables access to all GET operations in PersonManagement

next.description: Get the next set of resources i.e. from offset to offset+limit

last.description: Get the last set of resources i.e. from offset to end

prev.description: Get the previous set of resources i.e. from last_offset to last_offset+limit

first.description: Get the first set of resources i.e. from first to limit
